definition: twenty (20), in a limited number of set expressions/also written using banker's character 念
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
component in Chinese characters, occurring in 青, 毒, 素 etc/see also 青字頭|青字头[qing1 zi4 tou2]

sentences.english: Smart, successful and good-looking Iwaya Sumire works for a big newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 聰明，成功和良好的前瞻性巖屋堇工程大報紙。

sentences.english: The room is lumbered with numerous cucumbers.
sentences.chinese: 房間裏亂堇着大量黃瓜。
重瓣堇型花，亮粉紅色有藍色噴點。

sentences.english: It is one of the varieties of cordierite mineral.
sentences.chinese: 它是世界上礦產品種堇青石。

sentences.english: African violets need light for photosynthesis.
sentences.chinese: 非洲堇進行光合作用需要光照。

sentences.english: The staurolite schist and cordierite schist have been discovered in northern Xiangshan area for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 在相山北部首次發現十字石片岩及堇青石片岩。

sentences.english: The main several preparations of cordierite-based glass ceramics are reviewed.
sentences.chinese: 簡要敘述了堇青石基微晶玻璃的主要製備方法。

sentences.english: For this reason, African violets should receive light for no more than 16 hours a day.
sentences.chinese: 因此，非洲堇每天接受光照不能超過16小時。

sentences.english: High-purity low Cordierite is produced by sintering.
sentences.chinese: 應用燒結法成功地合成了高純度低溫堇青石。

sentences.english: Cordierite glass-ceramic material is successfully synthesized from Fly-ash.
sentences.chinese: 以粉煤灰爲主要原料，成功合成了堇青石微晶玻璃。

definition: capital of the Jin State during the Spring and Autumn Period (770-475 BC)
lilac daphne (Daphne genkwa), used in Chinese herbal medicine
